intro: Seris salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaf seris, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a soft, silvery underside, giving it a distinctive appearance. Seris salicifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
